Reyes]] on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Glasgow]], Ruddy was on the books of hometown team [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] from the age of seven to twelve, being coached by [[Andy Goram]], before emigrating to [[Murcia]] in Spain in 2010. At the age of fifteen, after impressing for Torre Pacheco, he signed a contract for [[Real Murcia]].{{cite news|last1=Parks|first1=Gordon|title=Ex-Rangers youth keeper signs dream deal with Spanish club Real Murcia|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/local-sport/ex-rangers-youth-keeper-signs-dream-2250819|accessdate=23 November 2015|work=Daily Record|date=4 September 2013}} Ruddy went on trial with [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]], but he was unable to sign a professional contract with any Spanish club due to a regulation requiring young players to have resided in Spain for at least five years.{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/15185404.How_Barcelona_cost_Scotland_Under_21_goalkeeper_Jack_Ruddy_his_chance_at_making_it_big_in_La_Liga/ |title=How Barcelona cost Scotland Under-21 goalkeeper Jack Ruddy his chance at making it big in La Liga |first=Alan |last=Temple |work=The Herald |publisher=Herald & Times Group |date=27 March 2017 |accessdate=27 March 2017}} ===Bury=== On 30 July 2014, Ruddy returned to the United Kingdom, signing for [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].{{cite news|last1=Nelson|first1=Craig|title=Former Rangers youth keeper Jack Ruddy signs for Bury|url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/sport/football/shakers/11375695.Former_Rangers_youth_keeper_Jack_Ruddy_signs_for_Bury/?ref=rss|accessdate=23 November 2015|work=The Bolton News|date=30 July 2014}} He was first featured in a matchday squad on 8 November, remaining an unused substitute for their 3–1 win over [[Hemel Hempstead Town]] at [[Gigg Lane]] in the first round of the [[FA Cup]].{{cite news|title=Bury 3-1 Hemel Hempstead|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29907066|accessdate=23 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 November 2014}} Ruddy was first included in a league game on 28 December, again remaining on the bench in a 2–0 [[Football League Two|League Two]] triumph of the same score against [[Mansfield Town]], repeating the feat four times as the team [[2014–15 Football League Two|earned promotion]] to [[Football League One|League One]].{{cite news|title=Bury 2-0 Mansfield|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30566652|accessdate=23 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 December 2014}} Ruddy made his professional debut on 14 November 2015, playing the full 90 minutes of a 3–1 League One loss at [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]]{{cite news|title=Gillingham 3-1 Bury|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34753746|accessdate=23 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 November 2015}} in what turned out to be his only first team appearance for Bury. ===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== On 29 August 2016 Ruddy signed for [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a two-year deal, with the option of a further year, for an undisclosed fee.{{cite news|title=Young keeper arrives|url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/news-young-keeper-arrives-3277270.aspx|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. |date=29 August 2016 |accessdate=27 March 2017}} He was named on the bench once over the season, for a 3–1 loss at Derby County on 29 April 2017.{{cite news |title=Derby COunty 3–1 Wolverhampton Wanderers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39675692 |accessdate=7 February 2019 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 April 2017}} In December 2017, he extended his contract until the end of the 2019–20 campaign.{{cite news |title=Jack Ruddy: Wolverhampton Wanderers keeper signs new contract |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42427693 |accessdate=7 February 2019 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 December 2017}} On 31 August 2017, Ruddy was sent on loan to League One side [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] until 1 January. He was then loaned to [[Scottish League One]] club [[Ayr United F.C.|Ayr United]].{{cite web |url=http://www.ayrunitedfc.co.uk/united-net-keeper-ruddy/ |title=United net keeper Ruddy |work= |publisher=Ayr United F.C. |date=12 January 2018 |accessdate=12 January 2018}} Ruddy was one of nine Wolves youngsters loaned to Spanish [[Segunda División B]] team [[FC Jumilla]] in August 2018.{{cite news |title=Wolves send nine player on loan to FC Jumilla |url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/academy/20180831-wolves-send-nine-player-on-loan-to-fc-jumilla/ |accessdate=7 February 2019 |publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. |date=31 August 2018}} He made four appearances and was sent off at the end of his last game, a 2–2 draw at [[CD El Ejido]], for insulting the referee.{{cite news |title=El FC Jumilla remonta en El Ejido con un Donovan Wilson estelar (2-2) |url=http://sietediasjumilla.es/el-fc-jumilla-remonta-en-el-ejido-con-un-donovan-wilson-estelar-2-2/|trans-title=FC Jumilla come back in El Ejido with a stellar Donovan Wilson (2-2) |accessdate=7 February 2019 |publisher=Siete Días Jumilla |date=17 December 2018 |language=Spanish}} On 1 February 2019, he joined [[UD San Sebastián de los Reyes|S.S. Reyes]] of the same league until the end of the season.{{cite web |url=https://www.shropshirestar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2019/01/31/wolves-trio-secure-overseas-loan-moves/ |title=Wolves trio secure overseas loan moves|work=Shropshire Star|date=1 February 2019 |accessdate=1 February 2019}} ==International career== Ruddy has represented Scotland at the [[Scotland national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[Scotland national under-19 football team|under-19]] and [[Scotland national under-21 football team|under-21]]
